MANUAL: apt-cdf-export (1.18.0)

apt-cdf-export will output the probe set information stored in a CDF file.

Quick Start

To dump output the probe set information stored in a CDF file, use:

apt-cdf-export -c myCdfFile.cdf -ps probeset1 -ps probeset2 -ps probeset3 ...

or 

apt-cdf-export -c myCdfFile.cdf

for all probesets.

Note: This application is available for Linux and OS X platforms only, and has not been tested on Windows platforms.

Options:

This program will output the probe set information stored in a CDF file.
usage:
   apt-cdf-export -c myCdfFile.cdf -ps probeset1 -ps probeset2 -ps probeset3 ...
     or
   apt-cdf-export -c myCdfFile.cdf
     for all probesets.

options:
   -h, --help                   This help message. [default 'false'] 
     --version Display version information. [default 'false'] 
     --export export a CDF file. [default 'false'] 
     --file-md5 compute the MD5 of the entire file. [default
                  'false'] 
   -c, --cdf-file The full path to the CDF file. [default ''] 
     --ps The name of a probe set. Repeat for each probe set
                  to output, or omit for all probe sets. [default '']
